intro: Buchnera bangweolensis, commonly known as the Bangweol spurge, is a perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
